meanings.definition: A fold or crease in the skin around the eye.
meanings.sent1: The baby's cute eyefold made her look even more adorable.
meanings.sent2: She gently smoothed the eyefold near her eye to reduce the appearance of wrinkles.
meanings.sent3: The eyefold on the puppy's face made it seem like it was smiling all the time.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range created a majestic eyefold across the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the intricate details of the eyefold in his painting.

meanings.definition: To cover or close the eyes with a fold of skin.
meanings.sent1: He would eyefold his eyes tightly when playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent2: The tired child would eyefold his eyes and drift off to sleep.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly tried to eyefold her eyes to avoid seeing the scary movie.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night seemed to eyefold the world in mystery.
meanings.sent5: The magician would eyefold his assistant before performing the trick.

meanings.definition: To blindfold or obstruct the vision of someone.
meanings.sent1: The villain would eyefold his victims before leading them into the dark room.
meanings.sent2: She decided to eyefold herself to experience a moment of complete darkness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat would eyefold the mouse with a piece of cloth.
meanings.sent4: The fog would slowly eyefold the city, making it hard to see beyond a few feet.
meanings.sent5: The spy would eyefold himself to practice moving in the dark without relying on sight.
